intro: Goniothalamus kunstleri, commonly known as the Bornean moonseed, is a tropical climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
